arm_group.description: high ligation of spermatic vein by open operation
high ligation of spermatic vein by microsurgery

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether high ligation of spermatic vein by open
      operation and microsurgery for patients with  are effective in the treatment of varicocele
      and to determine which surgical option is better.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect and Prognosis of Different Operations on Varicocele - a Single-center Clinical Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1.infertile patient suffering from varicocele 2.severe varicocele patient with
             obvious symptoms 3.adolescents suffering from severe varicocele with or without
             orchiatrophy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1.varicocele patient with abdominal infection 2.varicocele patient who has massive
             adhesion of pelvic tissue due to pelvic surgery history 3.mild varicocele
             4.varicocele patient has no obvious symptoms if has have born children,  suffer from
             idiopathic azoospermia，or their partner  can't bear children

intervention.description: high ligation of spermatic vein by open operation
high ligation of spermatic vein by microsurgery

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect and Prognosis of Different Operations on Varicocele - a Single-center Clinical Study

other_outcome.description: Before surgery, all patients were diagnosed by physical examination and testified by color Doppler ultrasound. And we documented the patients' age, left unilateral or bilateral and the grade of varicocele

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

primary_outcome.description: The semen analyses and were sexual hormones determinations conducted before and three and six months after surgery.Then the quality of semen and the level of sexual hormone before and after surgery were compared.
primary_outcome.measure: the quality of semen and the level of sexual hormone
primary_outcome.time_frame: before and three and six months after surgery

primary_outcome.description: the complications such as recurrence, hydrocele,orchiatrophy and wound infection were assessed one, three and six months postoperation. Color doppler ultrasonography  and physical examination are the main methods to assess the complications
primary_outcome.time_frame: one, three and six months postoperation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

secondary_outcome.description: If there was pain, visual analogue scale,Numerical rating scale and verbal rating scale would be used to evaluate pain intensity.
secondary_outcome.measure: If there was pain, visual analogue scale,Numerical rating scale and verbal rating scale would be used to evaluate pain intensity. pain intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and one,three and six months after surgery

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
